page.title: 10RESCOBIE LOCH LANDSCAPE
page.content: Rescobie loch is one of three lochs of glacial origin in the{LANDSCAPE}of the area. The loch is 1.5 km long and 0.5 km wide. In depth it ranges from 1_5 m but during the summer evaporation may reduce this level. Under the loch is the{HISTORICAL SITE} of an old{CASTLE.}This was called 'Barnsdale' which means 'Valley of the Banes'. This name could be connected with a{LOCAL MYTH}that states that King Donald VII (Donald Bane) who was the brother of Malcolm Canmore, died there in confinement in 1097. Some say he was put to death by his nephew King Elgar.
